story:
We think scooters are awesome. Help us bring the world's first cargo scooters to you!

The Nimble Urban is the first scooter of its kind. It's designed to be the best way to travel short distances and carry over 50 pounds (25kg) of cargo. We've been making scooters for four years in California and now we need your help in launching our best scooter yet. 


The Nimble Urban Scooter

  • Simpler than a bike - Easier than a bike, smaller than a bike. Designed for short trips when all you need is a little extra speed. Zero maintenance and no grease

  • Easy to carry and store - Folds up and can be taken inside easily. Fits in most trunks and the tiniest of apartments!

  • Fits all sizes -  One size fits all with the Nimble Urban's adjustable handle bars (up to 6'4" / 1m96)
  • Carries more than you can - The Nimble Urban can hold baskets, bags, dogs, tools, anything! It can support over 300 pounds (~136kg) and fits standard bike baskets, racks and bags

  • Designed with a purpose - We've designed the Nimble Urban to be perfect for distances too far to walk but not far enough to be worth taking a car or bike. It's more versatile, more functional and more nimble than any alternative on the market

As seen on

See reviews: FastCompany, Gizmag, Inhabitat, TrendHunter, Core77, WeDemain

If we reach $30,000 by the end of our campaign, then ONE of these colors will be made available! 

1. Make it happen by backing us!
2. Help us choose the color you think totally deserves to exist by participating in our poll HERE. 



For Work and Play

The Nimble Urban's simple design makes it fit in anywhere. Whether around town or going to work, you'll enjoy your ride. With our team based in California and Paris, we set out to make a sleek, functional and stylish design which holds up to daily use. 

 

Over 50 pounds (25kg) of it! 

From groceries to dogs, the Nimble Urban can carry whatever you need either on its front flat rack or through standard bicycle bags and accessories. Your imagination is the limit with the Nimble Urban! 

Easy and Exciting

At its core, the Nimble Urban is fun. It's agile, quick and has a very smooth ride. You can wear any type of clothing without worrying about it getting stuck in gears, and never have to pump the tires. There's nothing easier than getting on a scooter and taking it for a spin!

Carry and Store It!

The Nimble Urban folds making it easy to carry and store.  It will fit in your car's trunk, office, train or even the tiniest of apartments.






 


In return for your contribution, we have carefully selected and designed a few gifts that you can wear, ride and show your support for Nimble Scooters!



The Indiegogo campaign will end in May and based on our experience making scooters for the last four years we know that we can begin manufacturing in June. You can expect your Nimble Urban to arrive end of June/July depending on where you live!


Made in California
All Nimble Urban scooters will be made in our cutting edge manufacturing space in Orange County, California. We do not outsource. Making scooters is what we do and we are damn good at it. 


A Proven Team

Nimble Scooters has been making scooters for large industrial and warehouse spaces since 2012. Since then, we've noticed a lot of interest from families and individuals and so we designed a more consumer focused product, the Nimble Urban. Our team has decades of combined experience launching automotive, bicycle and other consumer products. Scooters have been our specialty for the last four years giving us the production know-how required to deliver these kick ass kick-scooters to you this summer. 

Why We Need Your Help

We need $20,000 for the tooling required to make this unique scooter. This money will be used to purchase raw materials, packaging, tooling, and various smaller parts like wheels, grip tape, hand grips and quick-releases. The scooter goes through several steps of manufacturing including cutting, tumbling, welding and powder coating which all add up to the making of a Nimble Urban.


What people are saying:


Our friends and community on the Nimble Urban


If you like what we're doing and want to help us achieve our goals, share our work using these simple tools. Word-of-mouth & social media helps a lot more than you know!


FAQ


What is the total weight you can put on the scooter? 
- We recommend 300 lbs (136 kg) total on the scooter, rider and cargo included. It's been tested with over 300 lbs as well, without damage. For example a person of 190 lbs (80 kg) can ride safely with a good amount of weight up front in the cargo space. The way the scooter is built, as well as the folding mechanism, will not cause the scooter to fold in half under too much weight. 

How much is shipping to Europe?
- Shipping from California to Europe is $45 for a Nimble Urban.

How does the wicker basket clip on?
- All Nimble Scooters on this campaign are supplied with cargo straps that you can use to strap on anything. We've tested it with all sorts of containers and goods and it works great!
 
How do I choose the color I want?
- At the end of the campaign, we will send you a questionnaire about the color you´d like for your Nimble Urban.

Do you ship to Switzerland?
- Yes we can. The shipping system did not include Switzerland in the EU so we´ll send you an EU address you may use. 


Can you lock the scooter? 
- Yes there is a metal loop on the center post through which you can attach any standard bicycle lock. 

Can you take the Nimble Urban on a train or plane?
- Yes, the scooter has been taken on trains before, on the Thalys, Pacific Surfliner, Parisian subways and buses, without any problems, folded or unfolded. We have also packed it up in its box and flown with it. 

What kind of brake does the Nimble Urban have?  
- There is a flex brake located on the rear wheel which you use with your foot.

How far do you recommend going with a loaded Nimble Urban?
- The Nimble Urban is designed for short trips of about 1-2 miles. It works well on campuses, in office buildings, facilities, studios, to go to the local farmer's market, to school, around your neighborhood, etc.

What is the Nimble Urban made out of?
- The Nimble Urban is made of cold rolled American steel. We spent a great deal of time selecting the metal and we went with steel instead of aluminium because we found the ride quality to be smoother.

What are the Nimble Urban's dimensions?
- The Nimble Urban is 52 inches (132cm) from wheel to wheel but folds up to 34 inches (86cm). The Nimble Urban's height is determined by its handlebars which are adjustable from 24 inches (60cm) up to 38 inches (97cm) allowing the Nimble Urban to fit almost any rider.

How large is the Nimble Urban's rack?
- The Nimble Urban comes with a flat rack which measures 12 inches by 12 inches (30cm x 30cm). The rack can carry 50lbs (25kg). 

We'll add Q&A as they come in!

Carries more than you can - The Nimble Urban can hold baskets, bags, dogs, tools, anything! It can support over 300 pounds (~136kg) and fits standard bike baskets, racks and bags

As seen on


See reviews: FastCompany, Gizmag, Inhabitat, TrendHunter, Core77, WeDemain




If we reach $30,000 by the end of our campaign, then ONE of these colors will be made available! 
1. Make it happen by backing us!2. Help us choose the color you think totally deserves to exist by participating in our poll HERE. 









For Work and Play

The Nimble Urban's simple design makes it fit in anywhere. Whether around town or going to work, you'll enjoy your ride. With our team based in California and Paris, we set out to make a sleek, functional and stylish design which holds up to daily use. 




 

Over 50 pounds (25kg) of it! 


From groceries to dogs, the Nimble Urban can carry whatever you need either on its front flat rack or through standard bicycle bags and accessories. Your imagination is the limit with the Nimble Urban! 











Easy and Exciting
At its core, the Nimble Urban is fun. It's agile, quick and has a very smooth ride. You can wear any type of clothing without worrying about it getting stuck in gears, and never have to pump the tires. There's nothing easier than getting on a scooter and taking it for a spin!









Carry and Store It!The Nimble Urban folds making it easy to carry and store.  It will fit in your car's trunk, office, train or even the tiniest of apartments.


























 





In return for your contribution, we have carefully selected and designed a few gifts that you can wear, ride and show your support for Nimble Scooters!












The Indiegogo campaign will end in May and based on our experience making scooters for the last four years we know that we can begin manufacturing in June. You can expect your Nimble Urban to arrive end of June/July depending on where you live!











Made in California
All Nimble Urban scooters will be made in our cutting edge manufacturing space in Orange County, California. We do not outsource. Making scooters is what we do and we are damn good at it. 






A Proven Team
Nimble Scooters has been making scooters for large industrial and warehouse spaces since 2012. Since then, we've noticed a lot of interest from families and individuals and so we designed a more consumer focused product, the Nimble Urban. Our team has decades of combined experience launching automotive, bicycle and other consumer products. Scooters have been our specialty for the last four years giving us the production know-how required to deliver these kick ass kick-scooters to you this summer. 








Why We Need Your Help
We need $20,000 for the tooling required to make this unique scooter. This money will be used to purchase raw materials, packaging, tooling, and various smaller parts like wheels, grip tape, hand grips and quick-releases. The scooter goes through several steps of manufacturing including cutting, tumbling, welding and powder coating which all add up to the making of a Nimble Urban.



What people are saying:




Our friends and community on the Nimble Urban







If you like what we're doing and want to help us achieve our goals, share our work using these simple tools. Word-of-mouth & social media helps a lot more than you know!











FAQ


What is the total weight you can put on the scooter? - We recommend 300 lbs (136 kg) total on the scooter, rider and cargo included. It's been tested with over 300 lbs as well, without damage. For example a person of 190 lbs (80 kg) can ride safely with a good amount of weight up front in the cargo space. The way the scooter is built, as well as the folding mechanism, will not cause the scooter to fold in half under too much weight. 



How much is shipping to Europe?- Shipping from California to Europe is $45 for a Nimble Urban.



How does the wicker basket clip on?- All Nimble Scooters on this campaign are supplied with cargo straps that you can use to strap on anything. We've tested it with all sorts of containers and goods and it works great!

 

How do I choose the color I want?- At the end of the campaign, we will send you a questionnaire about the color you´d like for your Nimble Urban.



Do you ship to Switzerland?- Yes we can. The shipping system did not include Switzerland in the EU so we´ll send you an EU address you may use. 



Can you lock the scooter? - Yes there is a metal loop on the center post through which you can attach any standard bicycle lock. 


Can you take the Nimble Urban on a train or plane?- Yes, the scooter has been taken on trains before, on the Thalys, Pacific Surfliner, Parisian subways and buses, without any problems, folded or unfolded. We have also packed it up in its box and flown with it. 


What kind of brake does the Nimble Urban have?  - There is a flex brake located on the rear wheel which you use with your foot.


How far do you recommend going with a loaded Nimble Urban?- The Nimble Urban is designed for short trips of about 1-2 miles. It works well on campuses, in office buildings, facilities, studios, to go to the local farmer's market, to school, around your neighborhood, etc.


What is the Nimble Urban made out of?

- The Nimble Urban is made of cold rolled American steel. We spent a great deal of time selecting the metal and we went with steel instead of aluminium because we found the ride quality to be smoother.

What are the Nimble Urban's dimensions?
- The Nimble Urban is 52 inches (132cm) from wheel to wheel but folds up to 34 inches (86cm). The Nimble Urban's height is determined by its handlebars which are adjustable from 24 inches (60cm) up to 38 inches (97cm) allowing the Nimble Urban to fit almost any rider.

How large is the Nimble Urban's rack?
- The Nimble Urban comes with a flat rack which measures 12 inches by 12 inches (30cm x 30cm). The rack can carry 50lbs (25kg). 

We'll add Q&A as they come in!

story:
ADVERPRIZE (Patent Pending)

My name is Steven Campbell, I have a BSME from Texas Tech and have been designing products for over 25 years.  I currently live in Las Vegas and have worked in the casino/hospitality industry for 15+ years all over the world.  During this time I have designed products ranging from SCUBA, TV’s, medical devices, aerospace, slot machines, In-Room Gaming, etc.  I currently have 6 patents with many more going through the process.  I enjoy hearing people explain their ideas and turning them into reality.

While traveling I noticed that I don’t know much about where I am and what to do.  Going to a concierge is not convenient because you need to leave the room.  You turn on the TV and it has an advertisement channel, but that is boring to watch and you quickly turn it off.  Not fun and no impulse involved.  That is when AdverPrize was born, allowing you to play a game on the TV and win a prize, children or adults. 

AdverPrize is a hospitality marketing system.  Currently people at a hotel have money but don’t know much about entertainment or places to eat.  With AdverPrize, a customer plays a game and wins a discount coupon. These discount coupons in the game are set up by the hotel and can be changed at any time.  It works on an impulse principle by giving you a choice, which they pick, and a reason to go there.  Everybody likes to win and everybody likes to get deals; AdverPrize does both.  The hotel gets you to one of their locations to open your wallet, and you get a deal to open that wallet – everybody wins at the end. 

Contributors will be taking AdverPrize from a single test sight to a worldwide product.  I have used my own funds as well as friends and family to get to the test sight phase and now have locations interested and waiting on a delivery schedule.  Contributors will allow the most important step to happen, from a single location to worldwide use. 

The test run was a success using AdverPrize.  The hotels were happy with a new revenue stream, amenities were happy with new customers, and the customers were happy with getting a deal on entertainment, restaurants, and whatever was being played for.  AdverPrize – Everybody Wins.

Without your help, AdverPrize may never happen.  


WHAT AdverPrize is asking for and WHY:

AdverPrize is looking for YOUR help to get across the finish line; jump on board and let’s make it happen.  Here is a breakdown of what is needed to win the race.

  • Looking for $15,000.00, used for the following:
    • Building the black boxes installed in the hotels to run the software.  AdverPrize is a web based system, but the hotels want their database information internal to the hotel so we run as an intranet system.
    • Booth at Hitec (Los Angeles) in June, 2014 and G2E (Las Vegas) in September, 2014.  Attend and see what your helped make.
    • Finalizing all Patents
  • AdverPrize will be installed worldwide, so you are contributing to a worldwide product.  When you walk into a hotel and turn on the TV, you are part of that screen everybody sees.  Only people that jump on board will have their name forever on the website and also on a background collage.  When people talk about playing AdverPrize, you will be able to show that you helped make it happen.
  • If funds do not reach the entire goal, we may have to cut back on both hospitality shows.  We can also ramp up at a smaller pace and once revenue starts, build more black boxes for new locations.

Without your help, AdverPrize may never happen.


The Impact

Why should you contribute to AdverPrize?  You can change the way that hotels market products to their guests.  Hotels have coupons they give away, you can get them on the internet, mail, or in a newspaper or magazine.  With AdverPrize the customer turns on a TV or mobile device and gets impulse ideas on what to do.  You, as a contributor, get to say that you helped with the birth of this new industry. 

I have a successful track record with projects being successful in the marketplace, as well as being ahead of the game in coming up with ideas before their time.  As an example, I started working on mobile casino gaming in early 2000, which is now becoming a reality in casinos around the world.  AdverPrize will be that next revolution and you can help.

AdverPrize can also be used on home TV’s and mobile devices.


Other Ways You Can Help

I know that in today’s economy some people can’t contribute with money.  But you can put the word out for AdverPrize and if you find somebody that can contribute we can reward you in some fashion. 

  • When you are at a hotel, tell them about AdverPrize

  • Ask people to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Help get the word out and AdverPrize can be everywhere thanks to you.

story:
Since the “petroleum era” is ending, it's obvious that something needs to be done beyond waiting for the energy and transportation industries to discover the solution.

To this end, we've developed a a transitional solution, consisting of a Conceptual Design for an electric replacement for the internal combustion engine, in the form of an electric conversion Retrofit Kit for current standard vehicles that we believe is affordable and will yield 6 to 10 times the range of current electric cars.

We believe:

• This design can be scaled up or down to fit any existing application of current internal combustion technology.

• This design can provide the range, power and speeds currently employed in our transportation system…

• This design will use “off the shelf” components that already exist (nothing “new” to invent).

We are seeking start-up capital to do 3 things:

1. Build a prototype (proof of concept vehicle)

2. Establish legally defensible patent on the design to protect it and allow it to move freely to market.

3. To set up production facilities to produce automotive “gas to electric” retrofit kits.

 We believe this approach will make a positive impact that will allow average vehicle owners to do something positive toward deal with the energy situation, and maintain access to affordable transportation in the near future.

story:
Connect with us:      Website   Facebook    Twitter   Email

TechCrunch: “BitLock’s system means you can tap into the sharing economy by sharing access to your bike with others”

Mashable: “Keyless entry used to unlock your front doors, car doors, and now it’s ready to unlock your bike.“

CNET: “Toss your bike key with BitLock Bluetooth lock”

Engadget: “BitLock offers a bring-your-own-bicycle approach to bike sharing”

FastCompany:” With BitLock, it's now easier to share or rent your bike to anyone, and you'll never lose your keys again.”

GigaOM: “Could BitLock crack peer-to-peer bike sharing?”

The Atlantic Cities: “Start Your Own Bike-Share With This Keyless Bike Lock”

 

Download and try the Apps

  

 
 

Acknowledgements

I'd like to thank Stephen Jean-pierre from VizualJockey and Sam Leabo from 5AM Films for doing such a fantastic job on the video. Making the video with these guys were the fun and memorable. I'd like to also thank AJ Ahadi from SigmaProject for helping with prototyping and 3D printing, and Cameron Robertson from Lockitron for lending a beautiful Lockitron to us for shooting.

FAQ

  • How can I replace the battery inside BitLock?  To replace the battery, you must first unlock BitLock and remove the U-shaped shackle. Then use a screwdriver to unscrew the cap at the end of the internal compartment, slide the battery out, insert a new battery, and screw the cap back on. For more information see here.

  • How long does the battery last on BitLock? With intelligent power management, advanced battery technology, low power radio and actuation system, BitLock can perform close to 10,000 lock/unlock operations on a single battery. This is enough to provide a near 2-year battery life under average usage (5 lock/unlock operations per day) before replacing the battery. Plus when the battery charge level is low, you get a notification on your smart phone to replace the battery. 

  • Do I need to have a data connection on my phone to share access with others?  Yes. To be able to share access with others, both parties must have an active data connection on their smart phones.
  • Do I need to have a data connection to lock/unlock? you don't need internet connection on your phone in order to lock/unlock your bike. BitLock app securely cache access data offline on your phone.

  • Does BitLock operate under rain or snow? BitLock is designed to be weather proofed and can withstand rain. The battery can withstand extreme temperatures (-55°C to +125°C), however extreme temperatures can affect (shorten) battery life. Please note that BitLock cannot be submerged under water. 

  • Does BitLock work with NFC? No, BitLock doesn’t work with NFC. BitLock uses Bluetooth 4 (or Bluetooth Low Energy) to communicate with your smart phone.

  • What happens if my phone battery dies? The BitLock app allows you to set a unique 4 digit (decimal) combination code for your BitLock ( sorry zero is not allowed). Memorize or write down the code on a piece of paper, and keep it in your wallet. In case your phone dies, punch in the code as a sequence using the two push buttons on BitLock to authenticate yourself and unlock/lock. To learn more about how combination works please read the user manual from here. Alternatively, you can also borrow someone else's smart phone (or tablet), log into BitLock application on their phone using your own credentials to lock/unlock BitLock. Your BitLock key is stored in the cloud and can be retrieved once you successfully log into BitLock application on any phone.

  • How strong is BitLock? BitLock is made of reinforced and cut-resistant steel and uses a high security disc locking mechanism and a bent shackle leg. BitLock has gone through extensive strength tests and can withstand over 2.5 ton of pull force.

  • Can BitLock get hacked? No. BitLock relies on the same security protocols used in online banking systems. The encryption is based on open and published standards and protocols (AES 128 bit).

  • What happens if I lose my phone? In the event you lose your phone, you can disable its access by resetting your account password. We also highly recommend having a passcode on your phone to protect your personal data and prevent unauthorized access to BitLock application. Additionally, BitLock app can optionally generate a digital combo code for you when you register the lock. Write down the code on a piece of paper, and keep it in your wallet. In case your phone dies, simply punch in the code onto BitLock to authenticate yourself and unlock/lock. You can also borrow someone else's smart phone, log into BitLock application on their phone using your own credentials to lock/unlock BitLock. Your BitLock key is stored in the cloud and can be retrieved once you successfully log into BitLock application on any phone.

  • Can I use the BitLock app to locate my bike if it gets stolen? There is no GPS inside BitLock and there should not be. Because you want to track your bike not your lock?! Typically bike thieves damage the lock to get your bike and abandon the lock. So tracking your lock will lead you to the remains of your broken lock. Also GPS tracking requires perpetual connection with cellular data network which would incur additional monthly data fees. Using GPS also would consume a lot of power requiring charging the battery every few days.

  • Can I start a bike share program using BitLock? Yes, absolutely! BitLock app on Android and iOS allows you to share access with friends and family at no extra cost. To start a large scale bikeshare system, you need to sign up for an enterprise bikeshare account which will enable you to get access to BitLock sophisticated enterprise-grade fleet management web application. Services fees apply to access BitLock fleet management software for enterprise bikeshare programs. For more information please visit http://www.bitlock.co/bikeshare.html or contact us at bikeshare@bitlock.co

  • Is there a subscription fee to use BitLock? There will be no extra fee to use BitLock hardware as well as iOS and Android applications. Services fees apply to access BitLock fleet management software for enterprise bikeshare programs. For more information please visit http://www.bitlock.co/bikeshare.html or contact us at bikeshare@bitlock.co

  • What type of battery is used in BitLock? The battery type used in BitLock is CR14505. You can purchase this type of battery online. For example, this online store sells this type of battery for $1.5 

  • Can BitLock receive firmware updates? We can securely push firmware updates over-the-air (OTA) to the locks. The firmware will automatically download once the lock connects to an authenticated smartphone. Please note that we encrypt and sign the firmware image for maximum security so that non-authorized parties or adversaries cannot push a malicious update.

  • Is BitLock covered by manufacturer's warranty? BitLock warrants the Device against defects in materials and workmanship under normal use for a period of one (1) year from the date of purchase (“Warranty Period”). If a Device is returned to BitLock during the Warranty Period and BitLock determines that the Device is defective, BitLock will either repair, recondition, or replace the unit with either a new or a refurbished BitLock smart lock, or refund the original purchase price either in form of cash or credit to purchase other products from Mesh Motion Inc in return for the Device, at Mesh Motion’s discretion. Please read the complete warranty/return/refund policy here.

  • Do I get a notification/alarm if the bike is being tampered with? BitLock as of now does not provide tamper-detection and alerts. 

  • Does the lock attach to the bike? The locking mechanism is not bound to the bicycle, however each lock does come with a mount to secure the lock while the bike is in use.

  • Is there a sim card inside? No, the BitLock sends and receives information solely through bluetooth communication with your smartphone, making a SIM card unnecessary.

For more details and information, you can refer to BitLock Help Desk here.

Connect with us:      Website   Facebook    Twitter   Email
TechCrunch: “BitLock’s system means you can tap into the sharing economy by sharing access to your bike with others”
Mashable: “Keyless entry used to unlock your front doors, car doors, and now it’s ready to unlock your bike.“
CNET: “Toss your bike key with BitLock Bluetooth lock”
Engadget: “BitLock offers a bring-your-own-bicycle approach to bike sharing”
FastCompany:” With BitLock, it's now easier to share or rent your bike to anyone, and you'll never lose your keys again.”
GigaOM: “Could BitLock crack peer-to-peer bike sharing?”
The Atlantic Cities: “Start Your Own Bike-Share With This Keyless Bike Lock”
 
 
Lock and unlock your bike instantly at press of a button!



 
Features

Keyless 
Say goodbye to keys. Never again worry about losing your key, searching for them in your purse, pocket, or on your key ring. 

Share Access
Share the location and access to your bike with friends and family. With BitLock, you can create and set up your own bike share system.

Geo-tagging
BitLock app remembers your bike location under the hood as you lock/unlock your bike using your phone GPS. This way you will never forget the last parked location of your bike.

Long battery life
With an ingenious design, intelligent power management, advanced battery technology, low power radio and actuation system, BitLock can perform 10,000 lock/unlock operations on a single battery. This is enough to provide a more than 2 year battery life. The battery used in BitLock can be easily replaced with a new battery afterwards.

Weather resistant
BitLock is designed to withstand inclement weather conditions. The internal components are sealed and weatherproofed inside a plastic compartment. The electronics and battery can also operate under an extended temperature range.

Secure
BitLock uses encryption found in online banking systems, so bike thieves are better off going after banks than to mess with your bike. BitLock is made of reinforced and heat-treated steel combined with a high security disc locking mechanism and a bent shackle foot design.

iPhone and Android
BitLock app can run on both iPhone and Android. iPhones models after iPhone 4 running iOS 8+ as well as Android phones running KitKit 4.4 and more recent Android versions are supported. 
 

 
Download and try the Apps
  

 
How to setup your lock

How the combination works

 
Download User Manual
You can download user manuals PDF file from here to better understand the setup and registration process before pledging for your BitLock.


Performance Test Results
Pull Test

BitLock has gone through extensive pull test and can withstand a pull force of close to 5000 pounds (2.2 tons). 
Salt Spray Test

BitLock body and U-bar are zinc plated to withstand corrosion. The standard test for corrosion is called Salt Spray test. Every 24 hours of salt stray test is equivalent (very roughly) to a year of being out in the field. The test was performed for 144 hours with no visible red corrosion.  
Test result:  0% of rust or red corrosion was observed.
Surface finish: zinc plate.
zinc layer thickness: 3.5um to 4um.
Test period: 144 Hours
Test date: 2015-2-2  to  2015-2-9
Weather Proof Test
BitLock was immersed under the water at 30cm depth for 30 minutes for water intrusion test. BitLock is no supposed to be immersed under water under normal usage and this test was only to push the limits on water intrusion test.



 
 
 


 
Acknowledgements
I'd like to thank Stephen Jean-pierre from VizualJockey and Sam Leabo from 5AM Films for doing such a fantastic job on the video. Making the video with these guys were the fun and memorable. I'd like to also thank AJ Ahadi from SigmaProject for helping with prototyping and 3D printing, and Cameron Robertson from Lockitron for lending a beautiful Lockitron to us for shooting.

What happens if I lose my phone? In the event you lose your phone, you can disable its access by resetting your account password. We also highly recommend having a passcode on your phone to protect your personal data and prevent unauthorized access to BitLock application. Additionally, BitLock app can optionally generate a digital combo code for you when you register the lock. Write down the code on a piece of paper, and keep it in your wallet. In case your phone dies, simply punch in the code onto BitLock to authenticate yourself and unlock/lock. You can also borrow someone else's smart phone, log into BitLock application on their phone using your own credentials to lock/unlock BitLock. Your BitLock key is stored in the cloud and can be retrieved once you successfully log into BitLock application on any phone.
Can I use the BitLock app to locate my bike if it gets stolen? There is no GPS inside BitLock and there should not be. Because you want to track your bike not your lock?! Typically bike thieves damage the lock to get your bike and abandon the lock. So tracking your lock will lead you to the remains of your broken lock. Also GPS tracking requires perpetual connection with cellular data network which would incur additional monthly data fees. Using GPS also would consume a lot of power requiring charging the battery every few days.
Can I start a bike share program using BitLock? Yes, absolutely! BitLock app on Android and iOS allows you to share access with friends and family at no extra cost. To start a large scale bikeshare system, you need to sign up for an enterprise bikeshare account which will enable you to get access to BitLock sophisticated enterprise-grade fleet management web application. Services fees apply to access BitLock fleet management software for enterprise bikeshare programs. For more information please visit http://www.bitlock.co/bikeshare.html or contact us at bikeshare@bitlock.co
Is there a subscription fee to use BitLock? There will be no extra fee to use BitLock hardware as well as iOS and Android applications. Services fees apply to access BitLock fleet management software for enterprise bikeshare programs. For more information please visit http://www.bitlock.co/bikeshare.html or contact us at bikeshare@bitlock.co
What type of battery is used in BitLock? The battery type used in BitLock is CR14505. You can purchase this type of battery online. For example, this online store sells this type of battery for $1.5 
Can BitLock receive firmware updates? We can securely push firmware updates over-the-air (OTA) to the locks. The firmware will automatically download once the lock connects to an authenticated smartphone. Please note that we encrypt and sign the firmware image for maximum security so that non-authorized parties or adversaries cannot push a malicious update.
Is BitLock covered by manufacturer's warranty? BitLock warrants the Device against defects in materials and workmanship under normal use for a period of one (1) year from the date of purchase (“Warranty Period”). If a Device is returned to BitLock during the Warranty Period and BitLock determines that the Device is defective, BitLock will either repair, recondition, or replace the unit with either a new or a refurbished BitLock smart lock, or refund the original purchase price either in form of cash or credit to purchase other products from Mesh Motion Inc in return for the Device, at Mesh Motion’s discretion. Please read the complete warranty/return/refund policy here.
Do I get a notification/alarm if the bike is being tampered with? BitLock as of now does not provide tamper-detection and alerts. 
Does the lock attach to the bike? The locking mechanism is not bound to the bicycle, however each lock does come with a mount to secure the lock while the bike is in use.
Is there a sim card inside? No, the BitLock sends and receives information solely through bluetooth communication with your smartphone, making a SIM card unnecessary.

For more details and information, you can refer to BitLock Help Desk here.

story:
Be the First Rider!

We’ve worked hard to offer the TeamGee board at a low price to our early backers. We want as many people to try our electric board and share their experiences and thoughts with us and the community at large.  We'll be releasing contest details very shortly, but the winner will become an official TeamGee ambassador and free board tester. That means if you win you’ll receive every new board we make for free to test for the rest of your life!

Now you can buy this board on our website: www.teamgee.com


 

TeamGee H9 Board Design

The final TeamGee H9 board design features Drop-Through Trucks and 90mm Black Wheels. Thanks to Daniel Kwan’s review of the TeamGee you can see the final look of the board (minus the blue transparent wheels). Meaning the board our backers will receive will look just like this one but will feature 90mm Black Wheels!
 

 

TeamGee is a revolutionary electric longboard designed to be as lightweight as possible. Weighing just 13 lbs, it provides all the features of competing electric boards without any of the extra bulk.

 

Fulfill your need for speed with TeamGee. Built with 2 different speed modes allowing you to get comfortable on the board before gunning it at the 23 mph top speed. Switch between the modes with the click of a button on your handheld ergonomic remote.

Feel the wind in your hair and freedom beneath your feet as you cruise along a top speed of 23 mph. Powered by silent dual 380w In-Wheel Hub Motors, TeamGee has a range of 11 miles and will get you where you’re going, fast.

 

And you’ll never spend too long with a dead battery thanks to TeamGee’s 2 hour 0-100% recharge time.

 

Team Gee is built with an advanced battery bank that is as thin as the deck itself and built right into it. This gives you a sleek electric board while safely protecting the battery from weather and damage. So there’s no more bulky battery packs you have to worry about damaging or getting wet, just a lean, powerful board beneath your feet.

 

Designed to accommodate any level of rider, from the timid amateur to the adrenaline seeking veteran, Teamgee is the easiest electric longboard to jump on and start cruising.

Thanks to its integrated battery and shorter trucks the TeamGee sit closer to the ground resulting in a lower centre of gravity for better rider balance and easier turning or carving. So you can take it downhill  or on the tightest turns and it'll handle just like a regular longboard.

With its intuitive ergonomic remote the TeamGee is easy to control. Its acceleration and braking respond quickly allowing you to find the perfect speed and slow down right when you need to.

 

 

 

The TeamGee ergonomic remote control is unlike any other. Featuring a digital display and intuitive design, it will not only allow you to control your board perfectly but will keep you informed about your speed, battery levels, and direction of your TeamGee electric longboard. The remote is even outfitted with a LED flashlight to help you see in in the dark.

 

TeamGee is made to endure the trials of the road. The deck is made of 11-Ply Canadian Maple and Carbon Fiber, giving it a strong durability but also allowing it to bend and flex like a regular longboard. This design also allows the integrated battery cells to stay protected and bend with the board.

 

The In-Wheel Hub Motors TeamGee arrives are 90mm PU wheels which give you less drag, last longer, weigh less, offer better brakes, and provide you with a silent ride (there is no extraneous sound like you’ll notice on belt-driven systems).

You’ll also be able to kick push the TeamGee if you find yourself out of battery.

 

The In-Wheel Hub Motors also have regenerative braking meaning when you are going downhill or slowing down you’re recharging your battery.

And the motors are powerful enough to take you up hills as steep as 20° so you won’t have to push against gravity.

 

​

 

Share Our Campaign To Get A Free Sheet of Black Grip Tape


We have a limited amount of the Black Grip Tape seen on our prototype design and we’d like to offer these out to our wonderful backers!

To receive a FREE black grip tape design:

1) Please share our campaign link on Facebook or Twitter

2) Take a screenshot of the post

3) Send it to market@teamgeeboard.com

AND

we’ll include the black grip tape in your order!
 

 


Press and Media

Interested in writing or featuring the TeamGee in one of your upcoming articles or reviews? You can find a copy of our PRESS KIT HERE, or you can reach out to us to chat more at team@teamgeeboard.com

How much does it weigh?
TeamGee weighs 13 lbs or 5.8 kgs 

Will you be shipping globally?
Yes, we are offering global shipping!

When will you start shipping?
If you order your board before June we will ship it June. All other boards will be shipped July to August.

What is TeamGee’s battery?
TeamGee uses a polymer lithium battery.

How long does it take to charge?
TeamGee charges fully in 2 hours.

Is the TeamGee water resistant?
TeamGee is rated IP54 meaning it is water and splash resistant; it’s grip paper is waterproof as well.

Can it go uphill?
Yes, TeamGee can climb 20 degree hills (30% tilt).

What is the max load of the TeamGee?
The max load is 285 lbs (130kg).

How big is the board?
940mm×215mm×120mm

How do I control the board?
You can control your board with the ergonomic remote.

What grip tape will the board arrive with, there are two types on your Campaign Page?
The TeamGee will arrive with the blue/red/black grip tape that is seen on the perk's sidebar (not the fully black grip tape).

What do I do when the tires around my Hub Motors wear down?
TeamGee’s in-wheel HUB motors are easily replaceable, from the motor to the tire.

Does it have regenerative brakes?
Yes, it does. The regenerative brakes activate when you are going downhill or whenever you activate the brakes themselves with the ergonomic remote.

Can I bring it on an airplane?
No you cannot due to the battery size being too large. You can only check it.

Do you offer any warranty?
If you experience quality problems, we will send replacement parts so you can fix the issues you are facing; if you are not capable of fixing it, we will contact a local agency/skate shop to fix it for you. If the product is damaged by you in some way, we may charge for replacement parts.

Will I have to pay the import cost for the TeamGee?
This highly depends on where we are shipping to. Some countries will slap a duty charge to the TeamGee, others won’t.

story:
Hi, My name is Param Jaggi. Welcome to my 'Algae Based Emission System' page! I have been working on this project since I was in high school and it has truly become a part of my life. This could turn my dreams into a reality. 

  

 

Who am I? 

I am a student, inventor, and entrepreneur. I began researching in the field of environmental and energy technologies at the age of 13. Since then, I have:

  • Innovated bio-fuel preparation
  • Designed highly effective bioreactors
  • Created microturbine systems to efficiently harness wind energy
  • Created a device that mitigates motor vehicle emissions
  • And many more.

I have been recognized by Popular Science, EPA, Intel, Nominated for 'Texan of the Year', and even included in Forbes Magazine's '30 Under 30: Energy'. Essentially, I have a strong passion to change the world by creating a cleaner environment to live in. 

In July of this year, I started my own green technology company, EcoViate. The company focuses on innovative green technology designs that can have an impact on our current environment and energy systems. We are striving to create a deviation form the norms of innovation. 

  

 

What is the invention?

I am the proud inventor of ABES (Algae Based Emission System). 

The ABES is an anti-pollutant device that fits into the exhaust of any motor vehicle (or potentially an industrial plant) and reduces emissions through the photosynthesis of algae, acid/base reactions, and a variety of other neutralizing species. The device is founded on concepts of environmental engineering and complexities of bio-active processes in high heat and pressure.

 

                 

 

 A simplified design of my most efficient model: 

 

 

Algae is used within the device and is placed adhesively to aluminum-alloy metal plates. The algae becomes highly heat-resistant through replicating evolution in the lab. (Increasing the temperature of the algal cells at low increments until only a small variety of strains are left). 

 

 

To ensure a stabilized process of photosynthesis, the device has a system or mirrors to provide solar radiation, LED lights, and a water source placed in a liquid-permeable membrane through the plates of algae (almost as a radiator coil).

The device is currently patent pending and will, hopefully one day, be able to change our current effect on the global carbon imprint. 

Link to the patent (currently pending):

http://www.faqs.org/patents/app/20100190241

 

 

               

 

 

The device began as a simple science fair project and has turned into a part of life. Even though, on the surface, it may seem as an environmental project, the science behind the invention has included:

  • Physics (energy conversions)
  • Chemistry (enzymes, energy of activation, acid/base reactions)
  • Biology (photosynthesis, evolutionary biology)

 

What is the funding for? 

The funding is completley going towards research and development of the product.

I have been able to bootstrap supplies (as you will see by the duct tape on my original designs!), lab equipment, and lab space for a few years now (primarly because I am still a typical college student), but now I think with the genorosity of the community I will be able to sustain proper R&D. 

I am asking for $20,000 for this project, which will cover research costs (data collection tools, lab equipment, algae growth equipment, manufacturing materials) and testing costs (I plan to do lab tests, simulation tests, and actual feild testing under proper surveillance). Any additional money will be put to more of the research and development.

 

Please help my dream become a reality while helping to create a safer and cleaner environment!

story:
Short Summary

  • MyKIDis.com is a rising social network site for Parents who love to Brag about their kids.  
  • We understand that in order to change the world, we must start with our children.  My Kid Is, wants to give an avenue for children all across the globe to receive pride and praise for their accomplishments by the people that matter the most to them.
  • Our goal is to have as many people participate in the beta site to complete development based on your feedback of user experience prior to releasing worldwide.

What We Need & What You Get

We are a funded project on it's own.  Our goal is to raise awareness of what we are doing, gain quality users who want to beta test and supply feedback based on this monumental project, have funds going to great charity sharing our mission of helping children, and receive great promotional perks!

Perks include bumper stickers, t-shirts, hats, and more to come.  50% of ALL funds raised will be donald to Ronald McDonald House Charities!

        

The funding goal is $8,000 for the benefit of Ronald McDonald House Charities of Central Florida - www.ShareANight.org

"While there is no charge to stay at theRonald Houses in Orlando and the cost exceeds $60 nightly, a suggested $15 per night assists with child a need.  Should a family not be able to contribute, they still have a place to stay in close proximity to the hospital.  It amazes me that such a small contribution can make a huge difference in the lives of children and their families during their most vulnerable moments of their life.  We are grateful that Ronald McDonald House is allowing us to assist in making a difference in these children's lives, starting in our backyard, right here in Orlando."

Louis Shain, CoFounder, myKIDis.com

The Impact

My Kid Is personal to me.  I have a personal goal each day to see how many people I can make smile.  In doing so, I realized the most rewarding and innocent smile is that of a child.

Our goal is to faciliate as many children around the world to smile!

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you have children, I am sure you are very close to people that do.  This rising social networking site revolves around bragging about children and praising their accomplishments.  It fosters self esteem and gives parents, friends, and relatives a way to show how proud they are of the children in their lives.  You can support this venture with as little as $1.00 or by simply sharing it with others.  As a proud parent myself, I know this will touch the lives of many and would love as many of you as possible to be able to be a part of it.
 

My 3 Biggest Supporters

With my belief in what I'm doing, I have been working 15+ hours daily for the last three months.  It really home, when my 6 year old sophisticatedly asked, "Dad, when you SORT out myKIDis, will you be able to spend more time with us?".   

That broke my heart, here I was trying to empower children worldwide, yet severely neglecting my own in the process.


My Kid Is, is my gift to them (and you) to share with the world!

 


  


Procceeds Benefiting Ronald McDonald House Charities!

When Lauren at Ronald McDonald House Charities of Central Florida heard about our story.  She asked if my children would join Mr. O, their dog, with a couple friends for a tour around one of the houses.  My kids have been so excited and sharing it at school.  It tears me that such a small act of kindness can make them so happy.  Ronald McDonald House Charities did that for my children and I want to make just as large of an impact for them.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Short Summary Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section: 
Introduce yourself and your background. Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you. Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve. 
Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?   What We Need & What You Get Break it down for folks in more detail: 
Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.  Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited! Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal. 
  The Impact Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make: 
Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world. Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one). Make it real for people and build trust. 
  Risks & Challenges  People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal. 
Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles. Describe your plan for solving these challenges. 
  Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: 
Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools! 
 And that's all there is to it.

story:
Whether young or old, we all depend upon transportation to maintain a good quality of life in rural communities like Yankton. We recognize that there is a transportation gap within Yankton County, and we believe Liberty Mobility is the solution. Many citizens and organizations have identified dependable, 24/7 transportation options as a large problem in our community. Liberty Mobility offers a ride sharing service just like Lyft or Uber, but is also willing to partner with existing transportation providers like Yankton Transit and taxi companies to make sure all needs in the community are met. It is the glue that fills in the gaps.


What is Liberty Mobility? 

In a nutshell, Liberty Mobility is the Uber for rural communities. They connect people with transportation options through technology and public-private partnerships. Riders can hail a ride through a mobile app specially designed to operate in places with limited cell coverage or dialing a call center. Liberty Mobility rides are provided by contract drivers who are background checked, trained, insured, and have their vehicles inspected. The service is also able to coordinate with existing public transportation options, whether it is Yankton Transit or a private cab service. Here are just some of the reasons someone might obtain a ride through Liberty:

  • Going to the doctor
  • Getting a ride for Dad or Mom to the grocery store
  • Headed to church
  • Your car is in the shop and you need to grab a ride to work
  • You need a lift home from a restaurant or bar
  • Your license has been revoked and you need transportation
  • Friends and family can use Liberty to make sure loved ones can travel to where they need to go safely – giving everyone the freedom to do what they need to do – without the burden of asking or changing schedules around. For example, you can schedule a ride for your elderly mother and track when she was picked up, the route taken to the destination and when she arrived
  • Organizations also work with Liberty to offer transportation options for their clients, patients, students or customers

What We Need 

The board of Yankton Area Progressive Growth (YAPG), a non-profit economic development corporation, will consider entering an agreement with Liberty Mobility Tuesday that will bring the company to Yankton County. Our goal is to partner with YAPG to raise the $25,000 needed by Liberty Mobility to launch here. Together, we can revolutionize transportation in our area and have a ride-hailing service before larger cities in the region — like Sioux Falls! The funds go towards:

  • The first two months of a local Mobility Manager’s salary
  • The first two months of office space rental
  • Call Center Utilization
  • Marketing ‐ Social Media, Radio, & Print
  • Driver Training for more than 40 drivers
  • Background Checks
  • VIN Inspection
  • Drug Testing

The Impact

  1. You’re creating jobs! One full-time employee and an anticipated 40 or more independent drivers would serve all the residents of Yankton County.
  2. Rides are $5.25 for the first four miles and $1.00 per mile after that. You are charged by the ride, not the number of passengers. So, even if you have three riders, the price for the initial four miles is $5.25.
  3. 80% of the fare is paid to the driver and thus goes back into our community.
  4. This will increase access to health care. Keys should not be required to utilize your medical benefits or get access to the doctor. Liberty Mobility provides transportation options that our current public transportation can not.
  5. Connect those in need of social services, like United Way programming, Ability Building Services, and others.
  6. It will give people the opportunity to enjoy the restaurant and entertainment options Yankton has to offer without the worry of how to drive to and from home. This potentially reduces DUI convictions and alcohol-related driving fatalities.
  7. It offers a way to reduce the social isolation of our seniors who do not have access to transportation.
  8. It complements current public transportation and taxis.
  9. Liberty Mobility has a non-profit arm that would enable people in our community who want to volunteer to provide rides to connect with those who need that service.
  10. This is a way Yankton County could be more hospitable to our tourists and visitors. It provides a way for people from the lake and hotels to visit our businesses.

Foreseeable Challenges

  • We need to come together as a community to raise the funds to launch this service that provides a needed resource for people of all ages and improves the overall quality of life in Yankton County.
  • Ongoing sustainability depends upon usage. In order to see a return on our investment, we need to use Liberty Mobility!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can contribute... but there are other ways you can help! 

  • Share this and spread the word! This only works with your support. Thank you!
  • Want to learn more about Liberty Mobility? Check out their website: http://libertymobilitynow.com/

story:
******Update******
 

Hi everyone, any additional electric boards you may want can be found at:

POWER Board:  https://sharkwheel.com/shark-electric-power/
THIN Board:  https://sharkwheel.com/shark-electric-thin/

We will be closing this Indiegogo down to accept orders on sharkwheel.com only.

Boards have shipped (May 26, 2020), now we wait for the shipment and hope customs does not delay us too long. Thanks everyone! For any questions, please reach out to zack@sharkwheel.com

 

Shark Electric Skateboards

Shark Wheel is the reinvention of the wheel as seen on Shark Tank, the Discovery Channel and FedEx commercials. The Shark Wheel is used by multiple Fortune 500 companies in various industries.

Introducing the newest innovation - Shark Electric Skateboards. The best electric skateboard in the industry.

 

POWER

Battery Outside Board | POWER

 ($1,499 Retail, $699 on Super Early Bird)

95mm Shark Wheels

26.1 mph speed

25.2 mile range

38'' x 9'' deck (7 ply Canadian Maple and 1 ply Fiberglass)

Remote - 4 speeds

Waterproof (IP54)

Charging Time 4 hours

Uphill 30% grade

4 speed modes

4 brake modes

15 lbs

Shred Lights can be purchased at the end of this campaign for a heavily discounted price.

Make sure your country allows electric skateboards to ship - please check before ordering.

Comparison Chart

How does the Shark Electric POWER board match up to some of the best electric boards in the industry?

THIN

Battery Inside Board | THIN

($1,399 Retail, $599 on Super Early Bird)

95mm Shark Wheels

25.2 mph speed

11.1 mile range

38'' x 9'' deck (10 ply Canadian Maple and 1 ply Fiberglass)

Remote - 4 speeds

Waterproof (IP54)

Charging Time 2 hours

Uphill 25% grade

4 speed modes

4 brake modes

15 lbs

Shred Lights can be purchased at the end of this campaign for a heavily discounted price.

Make sure your country allows electric skateboards to ship - please check before ordering

Shark Wheel Technology

1. Rough Terrain. The best wheel in the world over rough terrain. The sine wave shape tends to kick pebbles and small objects out of the way. Also the best wheel over wet conditions. 

2. Approach Angle. Shark Wheels perform similar to how drivers intuitively know to go over a speed bump at an angle to reduce the shock in their car. The unique 30-degree approach angle of the Shark Wheel reduces shock and deflects objects. A normal wheel is a steamroller and tries to go over obstacles in its way. Shark Wheels tend to move around objects

3. Lasts Longer. Scientifically tested to last 15% longer when cruising. Shark Wheel has multiple center points compared to one center point on a traditional wheel. 

4. Better Slide Control. The Shark Wheel actually spins as it slides acting like a car's antilock brakes. The 3 lips of the Shark Wheel compared to 1 lip on a traditional wheel give predictable slides. Also, slides are easier to perform due to less surface area in contact with the ground-less friction to initiate slide.

5. Lightning Fast. Less friction touching the ground, less rolling resistance. Up to 60% less friction depending on weight. 

Shred Lights Technology

Seize the night with 400 lumens of brightness from the ShredLights SL-200 front and rear lights. These USB Rechargeable lights allow you to see up to 30 feet ahead and be seen from over 2,000 feet away by cars. Only 2 hours to charge, fully movable. From 25-50hrs normal use time. Order after the campaign at a heavily discounted price.

Scientifically Proven

2 years of testing at San Diego State University, Mechanical Engineering Department

Significant advantages in rolling resitance (friction), wear (longevity), load capacity and off-road performance

Other lab tests have proven abrasion-resistance and speed advantages for the Shark Wheel

Shark Wheel technology is proven and is in use at multiple Fortune 500 companies in the material handling (forklifts/pallet jacks), agriculture industry, luggage industry, printing industry and much more.

Order after the campaign at a heavily discounted price.

Significant advantages in rolling resitance (friction), wear (longevity), load capacity and off-road performance

story:
THE MOVPAK

Movpak is an electric skateboard that folds into a backpack, for urban commuters. From the outside, it looks like a normal backpack, with zippers and pockets with enough space for all your daily needs, on your back.  However attached to the backpack, you’ll find your portable electric vehicle. By pulling a dedicated handle, the board effortlessly slides out, and using the small remote, you have full control of the speed and braking. To recharge, simply plug the charger into any standard outlet for two hours.

 

Commuters share the same challenges. They often deal with heavy traffic jams if by car, long walks to the train or bus if by public transportation, and of course carrying a bag or purse, to store their daily needs. This is why the Movpak is the best solution for the urban commuter. The backpack can carry everything you need, doubling as a personal electric vehicle capable of speeds up to 15 mph, and a range of 6 miles per charge. There are no fumes, no wires and no damage to the environment.

 

PERFECT FOR COMMUTERS

Movpak the hybrid smart backpack and electric skateboard, is revolutionizing transportation in urban cities, empowering people to move through the world in a more efficient way. 

 

BACKPACK ELECTRIC TRANSPORTATION

For the most part we always know when we’ll need a backpack. We never know when we’ll need to get somewhere fast. It’s light enough to use as your go-to backpack and be ready for those rushed moments.

Movpak adds a clever backpack component so the whole thing folds up and away for when you need to dash down some subway steps or go inside a building for work.

 

 UNFOLD AND GO!

Inside the backpack you'll find your portable vehicle. Simply pull a dedicated handle and the board effortlessly slides out. You have full control at your fingertips of the speed and braking system using the provided wireless remote.

 

35L BACKPACK

 

GREAT FOR STUDENTS

 

RIDE UP TO FIFTEEN MILES PER HOUR

Movpak is a fast and reliable portable transportation. Compared with regular bicycles or other portable electric vehicles, it weighs less than half of most of them. If you compare to a foldable electric bike, Movpak is lighter, simpler to fold/unfold and has storage capacity. All the other electric vehicles you have to carry it with one hand while in the other you have a backpack. The average person is able to learn how to ride the Movpak in about 10 minutes.

 

SIX MILES RANGE WITH ONE CHARGE

 

MOVPAK CAN BE FULLY CHARGED IN ONLY TWO HOURS 

To recharge, just simply plug in the included charger into any standard outlet. It's that easy.

 

EASILY SWAPPABLE BATTERIES

Six miles range is more than enough for most commuters but you can double the range with easily swappable batteries.

 

SLEEK LED PANEL WITH FEATURES CONTROLS

 

JAM OUT TO YOUR FAVORITE PLAYLIST WITH BUILT IN SPEAKERS

 

CHARGE YOUR PHONE WITH BUILT IN USB PORT

 

TALK TO SIRI OR GOOGLE WITH THE BUILT IN MIC

 

FRONT AND BACK LIGHTS MAKES IT IDEAL FOR RIDING IN THE DARK

 

TWO BRUSHLESS MOTORS INSIDE THE WHEELS

 

CLIMBS UP HILLS

 

USE THE BACKPACK FOR EXTRA SUPPORT

Learning how to ride a Movpak is much easier than any other board sports. First, because it has motors, with brakes, that prevents the Movpak from sliding when you get on. Second and best, you can press your foot and calf against the rear part of the backpack. This will give you added support, stability and provide you more balance.

STRONG AND FLEXIBLE

Movpak has a lightweight laminated deck that's constructed using a combination of wood, metal and Kevlar compounds allowing it to be strong and flexible at the same time.

 

MOVPAK HAS EVERYTHING YOU NEED FOR A SMOOTH COMMUTE

 

 

EASE OF USE


MOVPAK HAS SWAPPABLE SKINS

 

PICK ONE OR MORE AVAILABLE COLORS

 

YOU CAN EVEN USE THE BACKPACK SEPARATELY

 

MOVPAK IS IN STOCK AND READY TO SHIP

Straps | Remote Control | Helmet net | Battery | Power cable | Charger | Movpak | Backpack

 

COMMUTING WILL BE FUN!

*Contributors will be responsible for any import tax, duty or VAT that arises.       

 

 

       

 

 Is Movpak ok to travel on airlines?

Yes! Movpak is also airport friendly by both fitting in most overhead compartments on commercial flights and also by meeting battery size limit restrictions for traveling with. The pull out handle makes rolling Movpak super easy and convenient. 

We recommend you keep the packaging in case you want to ship your Movpak somewhere, or travel with it as checked luggage (never with batteries)!

Does it have a brake?

Yes! Just push the remote trigger backwards, and it will start braking. In fact, the brakes are regenerative, which mean that you will be recharging your battery each time you break.

I've never ridden a skateboard, snowboard, surfboard, or any kind of boards. Can I learn how to ride a Movpak?

Of course! Learning to ride a Movpak is actually much easier than all these board sports. First, because it has motors, with brakes, that prevents the Movpak from sliding when you get on. Second and best, you can press your foot and calf against the rear part of the backpack. This will give you added support, stability and provide you more balance. You can use your calf to make turns, just leaning forwards and backwards.

Can I make skateboard tricks with it?

We know how fun it is to ride, but we do not recommend this. Although it is very resistant and durable, the Movpak was designed to be a personal vehicle for transportation, not for extreme sports.

What is the maximum rider weight?

We suggest 240 lbs. However, the range, speed and hill climbing may vary according to the riders weight.

Is the Movpak waterproof?

The backpack is water repellent, and the motor is sealed. You can ride it in a light rain, and humid terrains, but never in heavy rain, with water on the pavement.

What are the materials used to make a Movpak?

Movpak was designed with the latest technology and materials, made from the same special aluminum used in the manufacturing of aircrafts and satellites.

We've chosen to use a lithium battery, a powerful brushless motor, all beautifully packaged on a light weight laminated deck that's constructed using a combination of wood, metal and Kevlar compounds allowing it to be strong and flexible at the same time.

We've redesigned the remote many times, again using the latest technologies, making it more appealing and comfortable, using simple one touch buttons for acceleration, braking and even one for reversing.

Is the charger universal i.e, can be used in different countries where the voltage is different?

Yes, Movpak's input voltage is 100-240v~50/60hz 2.0A. Although you may need an adaptor to fit your outlet since Movpak comes with American standard plug.

What type of braking system does MOVPAK use?

MOVPAK uses a regenerative braking system to help sustain the batteries charge.

If the battery ends, can the owner use the skate as a regular one?

6 miles is a long range. Research indicates that most of commuters are averaging about 3 miles everyday going to work or school and back, so we thought that 6 miles would be more than enough. Besides, you can always charge it in any regular outlet in just 2 hours or even get an extra easily swappable battery to double the range. So, that is why we didn't design this Movpak model for using it as a regular skateboard.

Can we charge devices in the Movpak. How is that?

Absolutely! Movpak comes with a USB port so you can charge smartphones, tablets and other gadgets. 

Isn't the backpack too heavy to carry?

If you compare it with a regular backpack, then yes, it weighs 16lbs. But we are talking about a portable electric vehicle, so compared with a regular bike or other portable electric vehicles it weighs less than half of most of them. Also, we've added a really cool feature that allows you to roll the MOVPAK instead of wearing it, making that option perfect for inside of buildings or even going through the hallways at your school or university. If you are going upstairs or downstairs then go ahead, wear it using the straps and you will be fine. 

 

Warranty and Support

Your Movpak has a 6 month warranty against factory defects. If you have any problems with your Movpak, you can contact our customer support team at support@movpak.com. Our team will work with you to repair or replace the parts at no cost to you. If needed, we will ask you to ship your Movpak to our warehouse to be repaired, and we will repair or replace your product, and send it back (repair/replacement and return shipping costs will be paid by us). Please keep your original box, in case you need to ship it. 
If the problem is caused by the user, our team will charge for the parts, services and return shipment.

International Shipping

Unfortunately, we can't ship worldwide due to some country specific regulations or logistics arrangements, but we are working to extend our list of available countries. Please e-mail us if your country is not on the list.
If you are not in the USA, please be aware of any importation duties your country may charge you when buying products internationally. And also, very important, be aware of your local laws and regulations to ride your Movpak on the streets.

Return Policy

Indiegogo is not a store, but rather a donation-based platform designed to bring creative projects to life. In accordance with Indiegogo’s Terms of Use, we will not offer refunds or returns for non-defective merchandise. If there is a problem or defect with your product, we would be happy to assist you. Please contact us at support@movpak.com.
While we are not obligated to refund a pledge post-campaign, if you are truly not satisfied with your Movpak we will refund your original pledge less a 17% restocking fee to cover shipping and crowdfunding fees. You must notify us within 14 days of your receipt of the product and return your product in unused condition, along with the original packaging. Please note that you are responsible for the cost of return shipping.

 

Share the amazing Movpak with your friends online through the social media share tools on the top of the page!

CLIMBS UP HILLS

 
USE THE BACKPACK FOR EXTRA SUPPORT


Learning how to ride a Movpak is much easier than any other board sports. First, because it has motors, with brakes, that prevents the Movpak from sliding when you get on. Second and best, you can press your foot and calf against the rear part of the backpack. This will give you added support, stability and provide you more balance.
STRONG AND FLEXIBLE

Movpak has a lightweight laminated deck that's constructed using a combination of wood, metal and Kevlar compounds allowing it to be strong and flexible at the same time.
 
MOVPAK HAS EVERYTHING YOU NEED FOR A SMOOTH COMMUTE

 
 
EASE OF USE


MOVPAK HAS SWAPPABLE SKINS

 
PICK ONE OR MORE AVAILABLE COLORS

 
YOU CAN EVEN USE THE BACKPACK SEPARATELY

 
MOVPAK IS IN STOCK AND READY TO SHIP




Straps | Remote Control | Helmet net | Battery | Power cable | Charger | Movpak | Backpack
 
COMMUTING WILL BE FUN!

*Contributors will be responsible for any import tax, duty or VAT that arises.       
 



        


 
 Is Movpak ok to travel on airlines?
Yes! Movpak is also airport friendly by both fitting in most overhead compartments on commercial flights and also by meeting battery size limit restrictions for traveling with. The pull out handle makes rolling Movpak super easy and convenient. 
We recommend you keep the packaging in case you want to ship your Movpak somewhere, or travel with it as checked luggage (never with batteries)!
Does it have a brake?
Yes! Just push the remote trigger backwards, and it will start braking. In fact, the brakes are regenerative, which mean that you will be recharging your battery each time you break.
I've never ridden a skateboard, snowboard, surfboard, or any kind of boards. Can I learn how to ride a Movpak?
Of course! Learning to ride a Movpak is actually much easier than all these board sports. First, because it has motors, with brakes, that prevents the Movpak from sliding when you get on. Second and best, you can press your foot and calf against the rear part of the backpack. This will give you added support, stability and provide you more balance. You can use your calf to make turns, just leaning forwards and backwards.
Can I make skateboard tricks with it?
We know how fun it is to ride, but we do not recommend this. Although it is very resistant and durable, the Movpak was designed to be a personal vehicle for transportation, not for extreme sports.
What is the maximum rider weight?
We suggest 240 lbs. However, the range, speed and hill climbing may vary according to the riders weight.
Is the Movpak waterproof?
The backpack is water repellent, and the motor is sealed. You can ride it in a light rain, and humid terrains, but never in heavy rain, with water on the pavement.
What are the materials used to make a Movpak?
Movpak was designed with the latest technology and materials, made from the same special aluminum used in the manufacturing of aircrafts and satellites.
We've chosen to use a lithium battery, a powerful brushless motor, all beautifully packaged on a light weight laminated deck that's constructed using a combination of wood, metal and Kevlar compounds allowing it to be strong and flexible at the same time.
We've redesigned the remote many times, again using the latest technologies, making it more appealing and comfortable, using simple one touch buttons for acceleration, braking and even one for reversing.
Is the charger universal i.e, can be used in different countries where the voltage is different?
Yes, Movpak's input voltage is 100-240v~50/60hz 2.0A. Although you may need an adaptor to fit your outlet since Movpak comes with American standard plug.
What type of braking system does MOVPAK use?
MOVPAK uses a regenerative braking system to help sustain the batteries charge.
If the battery ends, can the owner use the skate as a regular one?
6 miles is a long range. Research indicates that most of commuters are averaging about 3 miles everyday going to work or school and back, so we thought that 6 miles would be more than enough. Besides, you can always charge it in any regular outlet in just 2 hours or even get an extra easily swappable battery to double the range. So, that is why we didn't design this Movpak model for using it as a regular skateboard.
Can we charge devices in the Movpak. How is that?
Absolutely! Movpak comes with a USB port so you can charge smartphones, tablets and other gadgets. 
Isn't the backpack too heavy to carry?
If you compare it with a regular backpack, then yes, it weighs 16lbs. But we are talking about a portable electric vehicle, so compared with a regular bike or other portable electric vehicles it weighs less than half of most of them. Also, we've added a really cool feature that allows you to roll the MOVPAK instead of wearing it, making that option perfect for inside of buildings or even going through the hallways at your school or university. If you are going upstairs or downstairs then go ahead, wear it using the straps and you will be fine. 

 
Warranty and Support
Your Movpak has a 6 month warranty against factory defects. If you have any problems with your Movpak, you can contact our customer support team at support@movpak.com. Our team will work with you to repair or replace the parts at no cost to you. If needed, we will ask you to ship your Movpak to our warehouse to be repaired, and we will repair or replace your product, and send it back (repair/replacement and return shipping costs will be paid by us). Please keep your original box, in case you need to ship it. If the problem is caused by the user, our team will charge for the parts, services and return shipment.
International Shipping
Unfortunately, we can't ship worldwide due to some country specific regulations or logistics arrangements, but we are working to extend our list of available countries. Please e-mail us if your country is not on the list.If you are not in the USA, please be aware of any importation duties your country may charge you when buying products internationally. And also, very important, be aware of your local laws and regulations to ride your Movpak on the streets.
Return Policy
Indiegogo is not a store, but rather a donation-based platform designed to bring creative projects to life. In accordance with Indiegogo’s Terms of Use, we will not offer refunds or returns for non-defective merchandise. If there is a problem or defect with your product, we would be happy to assist you. Please contact us at support@movpak.com.While we are not obligated to refund a pledge post-campaign, if you are truly not satisfied with your Movpak we will refund your original pledge less a 17% restocking fee to cover shipping and crowdfunding fees. You must notify us within 14 days of your receipt of the product and return your product in unused condition, along with the original packaging. Please note that you are responsible for the cost of return shipping.
 




Share the amazing Movpak with your friends online through the social media share tools on the top of the page!
